CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 1, 1951, pg. 1, reads: "Beaten by Patrolman - John Davis, 23, of 1303 Wylie Avenue, shown more than twelve hours after he was allegedly beaten by patrolman 'Dan' McTague of Centre Avenue Precinct, early Tuesday morning during a questioning by the officer in an 'after-hours' joint on Elm Street. Davis said he suffered a possible skull fracture, injuries to his back and abdomen, abrasions and lacerations of the head, cheek, eye, mouth and loss of some teeth.  Davis is shown some six hours after his release from the hospital.  He was beaten at 4 A. M.  and released from the hospital that same afternoon.  No, the 'joint' on Elm Street, wasn't 'pulled.' - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: John Davis with bandaged face and missing teeth wearing bloody clothing, after being beaten by police officer Dan McTague, seated on bed in his home at 1303 Wylie Avenue, Hill District
